ingredients: 1 pound ground chicken (I use ground chicken thighs for more flavor)
2 teaspoons soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce if cooking gluten-free)
1 teaspoon corn starch (or potato or rice starch)
1 teaspoon cooking oil (a high smoke point oil would be best such as rice bran oil, grapeseed oil, or canola oil)
1 head of butter lettuce, rinsed, leaves separated
2 medium globe eggplants (about 2 pounds or 900 g total)
3/4 cup of enoki mushrooms or sliced shitaki mushrooms
1 5-ounce can tuna, preferably packed in olive oil, drained
2 Tbsp chopped fresh cilantro or parsley
4 medium-sized beets (any color), green tops removed, beets scrubbed clean
1/3 cup good quality light olive oil
3/4 cup mixed pitted deli olives, sliced
1 Tbsp chopped fresh oregano or basil (or both!)
Endive lettuce for appetizer boats, or chopped to add to the salad
Fusilli pasta, about 1/4 pound dry for one batch of the salad (use gluten-free pasta for gluten-free option)
2 cups diced cucumbers, seeded if the cucumbers are very seedy, and peeled if the cucumbers have thick peels
2 cups cherry or sungold tomatoes, halved
2 Tbsp finely diced red bell pepper
1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese (omit for vegan option)
1 1/2 pounds (24 ounces) prepared frozen cheese tortellini
12 ounces cremini or white button mushrooms, roughly chopped or sliced into 1/4-inch slices
1 large bunch swiss chard, ribs removed, leaves chopped (about 2 cups) OR 2 cups fresh chopped spinach OR 1/2 cup frozen spinach
1 1/2 teaspoons dried basil or 1 Tbsp finely chopped fresh basil
4 to 6 ounces Mozzarella cheese slices, enough to cover the surface of the casserole
1 to 2 medium sweet potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 2 cups cubed)
2 tablespoons neutral cooking oil (such as grapeseed or canola)
2 tablespoons neutral cooking oil (such as grapeseed or canola)
1/2 medium yellow onion, diced (about 1/2 cup diced)
1 15-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed
Apple cider vinegar or water, as needed
1 large (or 2 small) head(s) cauliflower, cored, broken into large-ish florets, florets sliced into 1/2-inch slices
1/2 onion, peeled, thickly sliced, root to tip
1 cup of fresh, canned, or frozen pineapple
2 Tbsp bacon fat, lard or vegetable oil
1 medium onion, sliced from root to tip
8-10 cups chopped collard greens, about 2 pounds
Vinegar and hot sauce to taste
1 apple, peeled, cored, and finely chopped
2 Tbsp finely chopped cilantro or parsley
2 teaspoons lime juice or a tablespoon of lemon juice
Pinch of freshly ground black pepper
2 medium large zucchini (a little more than a pound)
Handful of cherry tomatoes, cut in half
Several fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced, for garnish
2 large chard leaves, center ribs removed
1 teaspoon salt for the blanching water
1 Tbsp chopped fresh oregano or 1 teaspoon of dried crumbled oregano
1/4 teaspoon salt (more or less to taste)
Two 12-well mini-muffin tins, greased with a little butter or olive oil
5 cups old-fashioned rolled oats (not instant; use gluten-free oats, if needed)
1 pint oysters with their liquor, jarred or freshly shucked, about 2 dozen*
1 medium yellow or white onion, minced
1/4 cup cream (can use all milk if you want)
Splash of Tabasco, Crystal, or other hot sauce
Butter for greasing loaf pans or coffee cans
1/2 cup (heaping) finely ground corn meal (must be finely ground)
One metal 6-inch tall by 4-inch diameter coffee can, or a 4x8 loaf pan
1 tablespoon peanut oil (sesame or vegetable can suffice)
4-6 dried chilies, preferably Sichuanese, roughly chopped
Splash of soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce for gluten-free option)
2 Tbsp olive oil or grapeseed oil
About 4 cups of cooked pinto beans, drained (either
4 teaspoons of Chipotle Tabasco Sauce (definitely do
use regular Tabasco sauce, only the Chipotle kind)
1/2 cup high flash-point vegetable oil, such as grapeseed oil, peanut oil, or canola oil
Queso Seco (Mexican farmers cheese) or you can use feta cheese
Iceberg lettuce, thinly sliced and sprinkled with vinegar and salt
1 heaping tablespoon of minced fresh rosemary
1 teaspoon of chopped jalapeño peppers (no seeds, no stem, no ribs) either fresh or pickled
1/2 teaspoon coriander seeds (or 1/4 teaspoon ground coriander)
1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds (or 1/4 teaspoon ground fennel)
1/4 teaspoon cumin seeds (or 1/8 teaspoon ground cumin)
4 to 5 cups, packed, 1/4-inch wide sliced green cabbage (from about 1 small cabbage or 1/2 large cabbage)
1/2 teaspoon to 1 teaspoon salt (more or less depending on the saltiness of your stock)
12 ounces skinless salmon fillets, cut into two even pieces
1 1/2 teaspoons Kosher salt for poaching liquid
3/4 cup of seeded, diced, thin-skinned (English or Persian) cucumber, peel-on (you can also use regular cucumbers that have been peeled)
1 bunch of broccoli, cut into florets
2 cups (packed) grated sharp cheddar cheese (8 ounces), divided 1 1/2 cups and 1/2 cup
4 cups lightly packed basil leaves (about 4 ounces)
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (or slightly less this amount of table salt)
2 cup sliced crimini or brown mushroom caps (about 6 ounces)
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt (or slightly less this amount of table salt)
4 cups loosely packed kale leaves, chopped
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (or slightly less this amount of table salt)
2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
8 ounces mozzarella, sliced and torn into rough half moon pieces
4 cups 3/4-inch cubes of butternut squash (from about 1 3/4 pound whole small butternut squash)
1 large red onion, quartered and sliced (about 2 cups of sliced red onions)
6 cups thinly (3/4-inch) sliced kale (center ribs removed) (from about 1 bunch of kale)
1 to 1½ pounds salmon fillets, pin bones removed
½ cup dry white wine (a good Sauvignon Blanc)
1 shallot, peeled and thinly sliced or a few thin slices of onion
Several sprigs of fresh dill or sprinkle of dried dill
A few slices of fresh lemon to serve
1 1/2 cups (180g) diced yellow or red onions
2 to 3 cups (475ml to 710ml) chicken or beef broth (use more if you want a thinner soup)
1 15-oz. (425g) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 15-oz. (425g) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 1/4 cups (135g) corn kernels, fresh or frozen
1 pound 16-20 count shelled and deveined shrimp
2 15-ounce cans cannellini white beans, rinsed and drained
1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved or quartered
8 ounces (225g) fingerling potatoes, thinly sliced down their length
1 medium red pepper, seeded and diced
¼ cup (60 ml) low-sodium soy sauce (or tamari, for gluten-free)
½ cup diced red onions (1/4 of a large red onion, or 1/3 of a small one)
1 medium red bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 head butter lettuce, leaves separated and rinsed
3/4 cup fine cornmeal (do not use coarsely ground cornmeal)
Oil for frying (use peanut oil if you can)
1 head cauliflower, cored, broken into bite-sized florets
2 medium-small leeks, cleaned, halved lengthwise, sliced into 1/4-in thick slices, white and light green parts only, about 2 cups
1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
1 1/2 cups fresh breadcrumbs (3 slices of sandwich bread or rustic bread, pulsed in a food processor)
1 1/2 pounds carrots (6-7 large carrots), peeled and sliced thin
2 cups chopped white or yellow onion
3 large strips of zest from an orange
Chopped chives, parsley, dill or fennel for garnish
1 1/2 cups Arborio or other risotto rice
1/2 cup sweet corn kernels (fresh or frozen)
1/2 cup diced red bell pepper (small dice)
2 green onions, chopped (white and green parts)
3 lbs turkey thighs (preferred) or legs (skin on, bone in)
1 medium-large yellow onion, peeled and roughly chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)
1 quart (4 cups) chicken, turkey, or vegetable stock
2 medium carrots, peeled, 1/4 inch slices (about 1 1 /4 cups)
1 medium rutabaga, peeled, halved, cut into 1/4 inch thick slices
3 medium Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and quartered
1/4 cup chicken or vegetable stock (use vegetable stock for vegetarian option)
1 teaspoon soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce if cooking gluten-free)
1/2 cup chicken or vegetable stock (use vegetable stock for vegetarian option)
3 tablespoons soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce if cooking gluten-free)
1 tablespoon shaoxing cooking wine or cooking sherry
2-5 dried red chilies, roughly chopped OR 1/4-1/2 teaspoon dried chili flakes
3 tablespoons sesame, grapeseed, or other high smoke-point oil
2 lbs. of mixed mushrooms (oyster, crimini, button, shiitake, and/or enoki), roughly chopped or quartered (you want bite-sized pieces)
1 1/2 cups of snow peas or snap peas, de-stringed
3-4 pounds chicken legs, thighs or wings
2 Tbsp peanut oil, or melted butter (or ghee)
1 Tbsp hot paprika, or 1-2 teaspoons cayenne
1 teaspoon crushed chili flakes (I used chipotle chili flakes)
1/2 cup olive oil, melted ghee, or melted butter
1 packed cup grated raw sugar or pie pumpkin (avoid jack-o-lantern pumpkins)
3/4 cups toasted pepitas or pumpkin seeds (divided)
1/2 cup raw, unsalted cashews, soaked in water for 1 hour
2 chopped, pitted dates, soaked in water for 1/2 hour OR 2 Tbsp maple syrup*
1 cup risotto rice (Arborio or if you can get it, Carnaroli or
8 ounces clam juice or fresh seafood stock
2 cups of the smallest pink shrimp you can find
1/2 cup grated parmiggiano-reggiano cheese (you could also use pecorino)
1 4-5 pound cooking pumpkin* to yield 6 cups roasted pumpkin OR 3 (15 ounce) cans of pumpkin purée
2 medium yellow onions, chopped, about 2 cups
1 large tart green apple (Granny Smith) peeled, cored, chopped (about 2 cups)
4 cups chicken broth (or vegetable broth for vegetarian option, and gluten-free broth for gluten-free version)
1 teaspoon fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
2 Tbsp olive oil, divided 1 Tbsp and 1 Tbsp
2 Tbsp chopped fresh basil or Thai basil*
1 Tbsp chopped fresh chives (or green onions including the greens)
1 small cucumber, peeled, seeds removed, chopped
1/4 cup of sugar (depending on how sweet the fruit is, you may be able to skip all together)
